Section.Title: Overview
Section.Content: WhackerLink CPS is a comprehensive tool for managing communication systems, zones, and channels. This manual provides instructions on using the software, including adding, deleting, and updating various components.

Content.Step: Clone or download the WhackerLink CPS repository from the official GitHub page.
Open the solution file (.sln) in Visual Studio.
Build the solution by pressing Ctrl+Shift+B.
Press F5 to run the application in Visual Studio.
The main interface will appear with a search bar, treeview, and display page.

SubSection.Title: Search Bar
SubSection.Content: Use the search bar at the top to quickly find systems, channels, or zones. Type in the name or partial name to filter results in the treeview.

SubSection.Title: Treeview
SubSection.Content: The treeview on the left displays a hierarchical view of systems, zones, and channels. Expand or collapse items to navigate through the structure.

SubSection.Title: Display Page
SubSection.Content: The display page on the right shows detailed information about the selected item in the treeview. It also provides options to add, delete, or update entries.

Content.Step: Click on the "Add System" button below the treeview.
Fill in the following details:Name: Enter the system name.Address: Enter the system address.Port: Enter the system port.RID: Enter the system RID.
Click "Save" to add the system.
Select the system from the treeview.
Click the "Delete System" button.
Confirm the deletion in the prompt.
Select the zone where you want to add the channel.
Click on the "Add Channel" button below the treeview.
Fill in the following details:Name: Enter the channel name.System: Select the associated system.TGID: Enter the TGID.
Click "Save" to add the channel.
Select the channel from the treeview.
Click the "Delete Channel" button.
Confirm the deletion in the prompt.
Click on the "Add Zone" button below the treeview.
Fill in the zone name.
Click "Save" to add the zone.
Select the zone from the treeview.
Click the "Delete Zone" button.
Confirm the deletion in the prompt.
Select the item (system, channel, or zone) from the treeview.
Edit the details on the display page.
Click "Update" to save changes.
